full_text:
From: [b(6), b(7)(C)] (USANYS) <[b(6), b(7)(C)]@usdoj.gov>
To: [b(6), b(7)(C)]@bop.gov>, [b(6), b(7)(C)]@bop.gov>
Subject: RE: counsel having difficulty meeting with client
Sent: Sun, 7 Jul 2019 21:36:49 +0000

[b(6), b(7)(C)]
With apologies for the weekend email, we have a defendant, Jeffrey Epstein, who was arrested last night and is currently being detained at MCC, and is expected to be presented on an indictment tomorrow. His attorney, [b(6), b(7)(C)] has represented him in the past, and represents him in connection with our case and has been in touch with us throughout the weekend. He went to MCC today to meet with him in advance of the presentment tomorrow, but was just told he is not allowed in because he is from out-of-state.

We're concerned about the defendant not having access to his attorney in advance of the presentment (as we would be for any defendant) and so I wanted to reach out to you—is it at all possible to address this issue [b(6), b(7)(C)] can meet with his client this evening? I'm available anytime at [b(6), b(7)(C)] to discuss, if that's helpful, or [b(6), b(7)(C)] can also be reached directly at [b(6), b(7)(C)] if that's easier (though if you reach out directly to him if you could please just let me know afterward I'd be grateful).

thanks very much,
[b(6), b(7)(C)]

text_blocks.content:
From: [b(6), b(7)(C)] (USANYS) <[b(6), b(7)(C)]@usdoj.gov>
To: [b(6), b(7)(C)]@bop.gov>, [b(6), b(7)(C)]@bop.gov>
Subject: RE: counsel having difficulty meeting with client
Sent: Sun, 7 Jul 2019 21:36:49 +0000

With apologies for the weekend email, we have a defendant, Jeffrey Epstein, who was arrested last night and is currently being detained at MCC, and is expected to be presented on an indictment tomorrow. His attorney, [b(6), b(7)(C)] has represented him in the past, and represents him in connection with our case and has been in touch with us throughout the weekend. He went to MCC today to meet with him in advance of the presentment tomorrow, but was just told he is not allowed in because he is from out-of-state.

We're concerned about the defendant not having access to his attorney in advance of the presentment (as we would be for any defendant) and so I wanted to reach out to you—is it at all possible to address this issue [b(6), b(7)(C)] can meet with his client this evening? I'm available anytime at [b(6), b(7)(C)] to discuss, if that's helpful, or [b(6), b(7)(C)] can also be reached directly at [b(6), b(7)(C)] if that's easier (though if you reach out directly to him if you could please just let me know afterward I'd be grateful).

additional_notes: The document contains multiple redactions of personal information marked as [b(6), b(7)(C)]. The email discusses issues related to Jeffrey Epstein's access to his attorney while being detained.
